title: So much of crypto is not even real—but that’s starting to change
description: Crypto has long felt like a giant casino with imaginary chips, but big recent breakthroughs mean it's fast becoming part of the real economy.

title: Trump media firm dives into red hot prediction markets, in tie-up with Crypto.com
description: Prediction contracts will be available on the social media site Truth Social, allowing users to bet on elections and sports, among other events.

title: Melania Trump memecoin team ‘weaponized fame to disarm diligence’ in sprawling crypto conspiracy, alleges court filing
description: A new legal filing reveals new details of an alleged memecoin scheme involving the first lady.

title: Crypto lost 1,000 jobs to AI since ChatGPT launched—but gained them back from other sectors, says a16z report
description: The top Silicon Valley venture firm also highlighted crypto users’ interest in privacy in its annual state of crypto briefing.

title: Bitcoin bounces back more than 10% after brutal week
description: The biggest cryptocurrency gets a big lift from Vanguard’s surprise embrace of crypto ETFs

title: Coinbase CEO was having 'a little fun' when he trolled prediction markets by rattling off 5 words on an earnings call
description: "Well, I didn't trade on it, of course," Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong  said about rattling off the crypto words that traders were betting he'd say.

title: Vanguard has a change of heart on crypto, lists Bitcoin and other ETFs
description: The brokerage firm, long averse to crypto, will let traders buy and sell blockchain-wrapped funds.

title: Bitcoin plunges while gold rises, destroying the crypto ‘safe haven’ narrative
description: The lower Bitcoin tumbles, the less it looks like “digital gold.”

title: North Korea Suspected Behind $30 Million Crypto Exploit: Yonhap
description: North Korean hacking group Lazarus is suspected of being behind an exploit that saw 45 billion won (about $30 million) drained from South Korea’s largest crypto exchange Upbit on Thursday, Yonhap News reported.

title: Nobel laureate Paul Krugman says Bitcoin’s meltdown is deeply connected to Trump’s waning power: ‘Think of it as the unraveling of the Trump trade’
description: The Trump family, with ample crypto ventures, has lost an estimated $1 billion from the monthlong cryptocurrency free fall.

title: Crypto’s brutal month triggers a stress test for Wall Street
description: The Fear and Greed index — a tool that measures sentiment in crypto markets — sat at a score of 11 out of 100 on Friday, deep in “extreme fear” territory.

title: Crypto’s Brutal Month Triggers a Stress Test for Wall Street
description: Reversals of fortune are nothing new for Bitcoin diehards — euphoric rallies, then brutal selloffs. They happen every few years, or whenever sentiment snaps.

title: Wild Ride on Wall Street as the Crypto Crash Spooks Risk Complex
description: Wall Street’s risk machine didn’t break this week — Friday’s rebound spared it. But it flinched. And in doing so, it revealed how fragile the current market cycle has become.

title: Why bitcoin is tumbling toward its worst month since 2022
description: Bitcoin is on track for its worst month since 2022 amid a host of selling pressures that have derailed this year's bull rally in crypto.

title: Bybit Advances Regulatory Dialogue at Argentina’s Regulation Day 2025, Spotlighting Crypto’s Role in Financial Inclusion
Stock Rally Wanes at End of Worst Week Since April: Markets Wrap
description: Wall Street traders reeling from a bout of wild stock gyrations sent the market wavering Friday as sentiment remained fragile, with crypto getting hammered and Nvidia Corp. extending its selloff.

title: Fed Speak Has Spooked Markets, Roland Says
description: Emily Roland of Manulife John Hancock says talk of the Federal Reserve loosening monetary policy might have spooked the markets. She also comments on the collapse of Bitcoin and crypto on "Bloomberg Open Interest."

title: ECB’s Pereira Warns US Market Correction, Crypto Pose Threats
description: A steep correction in financial markets and crypto assets would rank among the top short-term risks to financial stability, European Central Bank Governing Council member Alvaro Santos Pereira warned.
